Process Animal Data

Process animal survey data for model building

Edwin Tan

2022-02-10

Source: vignettes/process-animal.Rmd
process-animal.Rmd

Dealing with data

Collected fauna survey data in the format detailed in the previous section can be easily subset with respect to town, round and/or priority with the filter_observations() function. A second survey reference dataset is required for input to account for surveys with zero observations. For example, a specific set of surveys (i.e. butterfly surveys in Tampines from 2020-2021) can be filtered as follows.

First, load the necessary packages to run the analysis:

library("biodivercity")

Load the example datasets and run the function filter_observations().

data(animal_observations)
data(animal_surveys)

filter_observations(observations = animal_observations, 
                    survey_ref = animal_surveys,
                    specify_taxon = "Lepidoptera",
                    specify_area = "TP",
                    specify_period = "2")
## # A tibble: 1,780 × 13
##    survey_id           point_id area  period cycle resampled start_time         
##    <fct>               <fct>    <chr>  <dbl> <dbl> <lgl>     <dttm>             
##  1 2 TPb13_E 2 Lepido… TPb13_E  TP         2     2 FALSE     2020-09-25 09:26:00
##  2 2 TPa70_P 3 Lepido… TPa70_P  TP         2     3 FALSE     2020-11-02 09:28:00
##  3 2 TPa68a_P 6 Lepid… TPa68a_P TP         2     6 FALSE     2021-06-03 09:25:00
##  4 2 TPa70_P 6 Lepido… TPa70_P  TP         2     6 FALSE     2021-06-03 10:02:00
##  5 2 TPa70_P 6 Lepido… TPa70_P  TP         2     6 FALSE     2021-06-03 10:02:00
##  6 2 TPb13_E 6 Lepido… TPb13_E  TP         2     6 FALSE     2021-05-04 09:33:00
##  7 2 TPa6a 6 Lepidopt… TPa6a    TP         2     6 TRUE      2021-05-17 10:04:00
##  8 2 TPa72_P 6 Lepido… TPa72_P  TP         2     6 FALSE     2021-05-27 09:25:00
##  9 2 TPa68a_P 6 Lepid… TPa68a_P TP         2     6 FALSE     2021-06-03 09:25:00
## 10 2 TPa15a 1 Lepidop… TPa15a   TP         2     1 TRUE      2020-07-01 09:25:00
## # … with 1,770 more rows, and 6 more variables: time <dttm>, taxon <chr>,
## #   species <chr>, family <chr>, genus <chr>, abundance <dbl>

Checks can be performed to remove ambiguous fauna identifications to prevent over-counting of species. These observations are usually identifiable only to the Family or Genus level and should be recorded as such. The function check_taxongrps() returns a dataframe of species entries to be filtered out at the point/area level when all species of the specified Family or Genus across all points have been observed at the point/area of interest.

For example, there are two species of swallows observed across all points in the sample dataset, Hirundo tahitica and Hirundo rustica. Hirundo spp. is entered when the species cannot be identified with confidence.

animal_observations %>% 
  dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(species, "Hirundo")) %>% 
  group_by(area, taxon, period, species) %>% 
  summarise()
## # A tibble: 27 × 4
## # Groups:   area, taxon, period [10]
##    area  taxon period species         
##    <chr> <chr>  <dbl> <chr>           
##  1 BS    Aves       1 Hirundo rustica 
##  2 BS    Aves       1 Hirundo tahitica
##  3 JW    Aves       1 Hirundo rustica 
##  4 JW    Aves       1 Hirundo spp.    
##  5 JW    Aves       1 Hirundo tahitica
##  6 JW    Aves       2 Hirundo rustica 
##  7 JW    Aves       2 Hirundo spp.    
##  8 JW    Aves       2 Hirundo tahitica
##  9 PG    Aves       1 Hirundo rustica 
## 10 PG    Aves       1 Hirundo spp.    
## # … with 17 more rows

If data entries containing Hirundo spp. are found in areas where both species appear in the same period, the function check_taxongrps() will flag Hirundo spp. for removal at the area level.

rmspp_town <- check_taxongrps(animal_observations, level = "area")

filtered_observations <- animal_observations %>%
  anti_join(rmspp_town, by = c("species" = "name", "period"))

filtered_observations %>% 
  dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(species, "Hirundo")) %>% 
  group_by(area, taxon, period, species) %>% 
  summarise()
## # A tibble: 20 × 4
## # Groups:   area, taxon, period [10]
##    area  taxon period species         
##    <chr> <chr>  <dbl> <chr>           
##  1 BS    Aves       1 Hirundo rustica 
##  2 BS    Aves       1 Hirundo tahitica
##  3 JW    Aves       1 Hirundo rustica 
##  4 JW    Aves       1 Hirundo tahitica
##  5 JW    Aves       2 Hirundo rustica 
##  6 JW    Aves       2 Hirundo tahitica
##  7 PG    Aves       1 Hirundo rustica 
##  8 PG    Aves       1 Hirundo tahitica
##  9 PG    Aves       2 Hirundo rustica 
## 10 PG    Aves       2 Hirundo tahitica
## 11 QT    Aves       1 Hirundo rustica 
## 12 QT    Aves       1 Hirundo tahitica
## 13 QT    Aves       2 Hirundo rustica 
## 14 QT    Aves       2 Hirundo tahitica
## 15 TP    Aves       1 Hirundo rustica 
## 16 TP    Aves       1 Hirundo tahitica
## 17 TP    Aves       2 Hirundo rustica 
## 18 TP    Aves       2 Hirundo tahitica
## 19 WL    Aves       1 Hirundo rustica 
## 20 WL    Aves       1 Hirundo tahitica
